Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Irving J
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The accommodations were a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better. . . .”
Reviews.Author: LoisSedona
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this property, without knowing the "Mortocycle Convention" was in town. The hotel is located next to a Waffle House, and the motorcycle attendees were driving in and out of the Waffle House lot, literally blaring their stereos through all hours of the night (2am and 3am!). I sleep with ear-plugs and I was woken up twice. Again, not the hotels fault. And the woman at the front desk could not have been nicer (gave us free breakfast coupons which we SLEPT through!) and she actually called the police twice. This aside, the location is great. Very close to the I-17, which was perfect for us as we live in Sedona. The rooms are spacious. There were some stains on the wall and carpet in the room. And the pillows were not that comfortable. Also, the mini-fridge was "off" when we arrived in the room (to save energy consumption?). I would prefer the setting be kept low, so we could put our perishables in the fridge immediately. Instead we kept them in our freezer bags. I would be willing to give the hotel another try, but I would strong recommend ASKING if there is a motorcycle convention in town before booking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: bellaviaggiatore
Reviews.Content: For the price, a well kept, comfortable hotel. Easy to hop on 10 to Tempe or all points Phoenix and easily get back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: We traveled all the way from Northern California by car to enjoy Spring Training. We needed those Sleep Number beds they have here at HGI-Phoenix Airport. They were the best remedy to a long drive. The room was so spacious and with my family of four we had plenty of room to stretch out. We brought an Xbox for the kids to plug into the hotel tvs which kept them entertained when they weren't swimming in the great outdoor pool. My wife and I relaxed in the hot tub as well, easily in close contact with the kids. After trips to the Grand Canyon, baseball games & long shopping days we always came back to a clean room with the temperature set just right. I look forward to next years trip and hope they'll have room for us again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our return home!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mbrayo
Reviews.Content: On our way home from our honeymoon we decided to stay here due to close proximity to airport... What a delight! When we first arrived the concierge; an older woman working solo, was so kind to us even with a line. Great first impression! The room was smaller then other Hilton Garden Inns but the swimming pool, lobby, and restaurant more then made up for it. The building itself felt warm and accommodating! Kudos for such a wonderful stay! Breakfast was awesome and timely airport shuttle made the stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to most places.”
Reviews.Author: Damian C
Reviews.Content: If you are loking for a very nice and clean hotel in the Phoenix area. Check out this Hilton Garden Inn. Rooms were great, nice, very clean, quiet, and very spaceous. Check in was very quick and Candy was very pleasant to speak with. She remember you by name every time she see you. Breakfast was a pleasure to get any and everything you needed, The entire staff at this Hilton was extremely nice. The hotel is Very close to the airport and they have a shuttle service to most anywhere you want to go within reasonable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a huge fan of Hilton Garden Inns, but found this was exceptional. All the rooms are enormous suites and I got an excellent prepaid rate on the Hilton website. My suite was huge, very well-outfitted (fridge, micro, coffee maker) and clean. The front desk was friendly and check in very quick. Somehow I found it difficult to locate as I drove from the airport in a rental, I called and was politely given directions twice...eventually getting there. I will admit that I was jetlagged, it was dark and I had never been to Phoenix. Also a slight caution -- there are two Garden Inn's and a regular Hilton around the Airport, so make sure you have the right one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to be near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Andrea D
Reviews.Content: We were mis-connected in PHX arriving late at night. We called from the bank of phones in baggage claim looking for a very short overnight. The front desk staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. The rate was terrific. The complimentary shuttle arrived in minutes. A wedding reception was in progress at the hotel that night, so Ree at the front desk went out of her way to put us somewhere quiet and away from the hubbub. Our room was spacious, clean, and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable. There is no doubt we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: peternoone
Reviews.Content: This one just doesn't feel like a Hilton Garden Inn. The other one at the other sode of the airport is the real thing. At this one I could not get anyone to answer the phone to get a wake up call. It was 3am and I called form my room and my cellphoneI stay in HGI about 50 or 60 nights a year and really think they are perfect for a road warrior like me, but this one feels wrong. I had to go down to the desk after calling for 20+ minutes to get a wake up call(sort of important for someone who flies 300k miles a year).I was 3am until about 325 am and I almost called the police thinking all the staff must have a serious problem. I advise any Hilton users to give this one a miss and go to the REAL HGI at the other side of the airport on East Van Buren. That one looks and feels like a Hilton property. This one needs a lot of work and doesn't even look like a Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay over”
Reviews.Author: Free_Skier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after arriving late fron NYC. The hotel is a ways from the airport if you are arriving, but close if you are leaving. After finding our hotel, chekc in was efficient, the rooms were clean. Nice touch was the front desk clerk asking if we wanted a bottle of water before we retired..and then not charging us for it. Too bad they have to charge for WiFi, that is a bit frustrating, but you can get free WiFi in the lobby or restaurant. Breakfast in the restaurant was good. If you are looking for a nice stop over hotel, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: briak-ky
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden is middle-of-the-road compared to other HGI's. Rooms were clean and front desk and cafe staff were attentive. HHonors snack bag with Diet Coke was better than the average HGI. Three items that drag on this hotel. One is that there are no good eating options nearby except for the I house cafe and a waffle place next door. Second is that the rooms have poor sound insulation. I had room on first floor and was woken up multiple times by the person above me walking in the room and flushing their toilet. This hotel is rather new and there is no excuse for not putting in more sound insulation for plumbing and between the joists. Water pressure in the shower was weak -- a common issue with older hotels. I would stay here again if catching an early AM flight. But! I would make sure to grab a bite to eat before arriving to the hotel and I would request room on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place that was close to the car rental return, which is some distance from the airport. This hotel fit the bill. The staff, knowing proximity is a consideration, hands out printed directions. Furthermore, there's a not-overpriced gas station on the way. The hotel is up to HIlton standards: clean and comfortable, good but not luxurious. One complaint: Their Internet connections aren't wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: MVTeacher
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal member of Hilton Honors and frequently book travel in a Garden Inn since these properties are consistently reliable. This property clearly didn’t start life as a Garden Inn. It is an all suites property and the rooms have the feel of a Homewood Suites (or similar). The extra space was a pleasant surprise! Check-in was effortless. Early check-in was requested and accommodated. Justin, the front desk clerk, is still in school studying hospitality management and, based on what I saw, he should go far. A true professional! Property is well maintained. Rooms were spacious with a separate living/dining area. Room was extremely comfortable. Even though the hotel is a short distance from the airport, it is situated in such a way that it is very quiet. Had two breakfasts with good quality food and professional service. Overall, I recommend this property to anyone needing accommodations at the Sky Harbor International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: unique14u2c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after a 20 hour trip from Australia. Nice hotel good clean rooms very well priced and great room service. Perfect for a stopover. Will stay again on my next trip to Mexico!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, excellent choice for business”
Reviews.Author: cheryl r
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a great visit! Everything was very clean and I really liked the layout of the rooms, with a sitting area separate from the bedroom. All staff were helpful & friendly. Looking forward to another visit:)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: This properties layout reminds me of a college dorm. This is a large property by HGI standards and it doesn't fit the standard layout. It seems they try to utilze each square foot of space. The hallways are long and seem narrow. The rooms were very nice. I was in a king room with a sofa, oversized chair and large flat screen TV. There was a little area with a table/work station. Fridge and microwave in each room. The rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable, A/C was efficient and quiet. Internet service worked fine. Bathrooms were equipped with standard HGI amenities, shower had plenty of hot water and pressure. My collegue stayed down the street at the Courtyard and he said it was a dump. I would recommend staying at his location near the airport which is like 5-8 minutes away. Shuttle service is provided also.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTim
Reviews.Content: Thought that it would be a good idea to arrive the night before a 6AM departure. The park and fly seemed convienent and a good deal. I arrived late and was surprised when the front desk person told me that the park and fly parking was behind the Holiday Inn Express right next door. You have to sign a waiver that if anything happens to you car while you are gone, too bad, it's your responsibility. There is very little lighting, of course it is uncovered, it's close to the dumpsters and there isn't any security. I should have just gotten up early and gone to the real airport parking. Of course someone hit my car and damaged the left rear pannel and scratched the rear passenger door. Didn't save much on this parking deal. As far as the room, it was clean and comfortable. Transportation between the hotel and the airport was prompt and the driver was very curteous.

Reviews.Title: “It was like being home!”
Reviews.Author: sassekp
Reviews.Content: From the free shuttle ride from the airport.. to the bartender, everyone was so friendly and down to earth! Some hotels feel stuffy when you arrive. Not here. The front desk attendants were genuinely happy and nice. My stay was short, but so enjoyable thanks to the staff at the Hilton Garden! Thank you! Kim Almont, MI

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeeee!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraL81
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn was a great surprise!!!we only stayed one night, but we wished we could have stayed more! Our room was so big!We had a little living room with kitchen and a couch, the bedroomm with a really comfortable bed and a big bathroom. Two tv, free wi-fi, clean, quiet. We ate dinner at the hotel and it was good. Service is also good, the staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night Stay Before a Long Flight”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAZMcBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we flew out to Maui. What a wonderful smaller hotel. Event though it is not your average 300 room monster this hotel was just what we needed. Clean rooms, large flat screen, dinner and cocktails and breakfast inthe morning. Not to mention the easy park and fly with a 24 hour airport shuttle! The staff was friendly and curtious and our can driver went above and beyond when we got a little turned around leaving Sky Harbor. Would stay again and reccomend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Super Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Beccaniece
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of it's location to the airport (Less than a 10 minute drive) and it exceeded my expectations. I was hoping for merely a clean, comfortable bed to rest my head before my flight and got that and much more. I was greeted at the front desk by a friendly staff and cookies! The rooms was very spacious nice sitting area and comfortable bed and free wifi in the rooms. The restaurant was fine, what you would expect out of a hotel decent predictable menu, but satisfied my hunger. Easy check out and front desk clerk gave me a print out with direction to the airport. When I returned home I realized I left my charger in the room I called they found it and shipped it back within days. Would definitely stay at this location again, great for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation with the family”
Reviews.Author: Big_Jon_AZ
Reviews.Content: Very nice king suite hotel with kitchenette and jetted tubs. Great breakfast (charge) and good restaurant. Friendly staff and nice but shallow pool. We love this hotel. While not the fanciest its a good, solid stay every time.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting place to stay”
Reviews.Author: matymark
Reviews.Content: While staying in Phoenix, I enjoyed my stays at the Hilton Garden. Food at the bar was great, and the morning girl at the front desk was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, spotless, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hwhitte
Reviews.Content: The front desk employees are exceptional. Food is good and hotel is spotless. I can stay anywhere each week when I travel for business, and I always choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: liz2011024
Reviews.Content: The location is close to the airport , the shuttle bus was clean and the drivers were most courteous. When arriving at the hotel we had a fast check in at 7AM. There were no rooms available at that time of morning so we were told to go to the dining room and have a coffee. We just finished our coffee and we were told that they had a room ready for us. The room was very clean. We had a very accomodating waitress at lunchtime. The dining room was about to close, but the waitress said it was no problem for her. The food was good. The front desk gave us suggestions how to spend the day. We had dinner in the dining room and it was very good. Our wake up call was excactly on time with two more reminders (just in case we had fallen back to sleep.). Check out was automatic. All the staff that we encountered could't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, courteous staff, comfortable, and close to Airport.”
Reviews.Author: nauticalmania
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located five minutes from the airport and offers a shuttle service to and from the airport. As a doctoral student at University of Phoenix, I have stayed here for both my Year One and Year Two residencies. The stay was first class, shuttle was timely and clean, fully equipped business center, and great exercise facility and restaurant. I'll continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LONG3
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. We stopped over for one night on a trip to Kauai. The hotel shuttle picked us up right away from the airport and brought us back to the airport in the morning. We ate at the on-site restaurant and it was really good. The room was clean and comfortable and we slept well. The free breakfast was fantastic. It was nice to have a hot breakfast instead of the normal "continental" fair. They had biscuits and gravy, bacon and sausage. If you need a hotel near the airport don't hesitate to pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: John58759
Reviews.Content: Impressive suite hotel close to airport with very comfortable bedroom, living room area, and kitchen. The desk was big enough for 2 of us to work at. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: If you're a gold member in the Hilton loyalty program, you get free breakfast when you stay at a Hilton Garden Inn. This generally makes these properties a good value choice, and this Phoenix Airport location is no exception. The hotel is conveniently located to the airport, and particularly convenient to the off-site car rental center. Rooms are a little unusual for the chain, in that they all have kitchenettes and a separate 1-bed bedroom -- kind of like an extended stay hotel. This makes the property a little better for solo travellers and couples instead of families, as the only other bed is a fold out couch in the living room. Furnishings in the hotel are attractive, the rooms each have 2 flat screen TVs, and the pool area is above-average for an airport hotel. I wasn't crazy about the beds (there's a knob to adjust their firmness), but I didn't find them terrible, either. Breakfast was very good, with cooked-to-order omelettes, eggs, pancakes, etc., and also a buffet bar with bacon, fruit, potatoes, etc. A restaurant-quality meal.

Reviews.Title: “Really, Really Nice Rooms & Stay -- Very Comfortable, Clean, Affordable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MomTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: My children, husband, dad and myself stayed here after staying several days at a resort in Phoenix because we needed to be close to the airport for departure. I was very pleased and actually liked the stay here far better than the resort because the rooms here are spacious with beautiful wide-screen television, mini bars and sinks in the commons areas and a spa/jacuzzi tub. The ice maker was right down the hall and they had a nice convenience/snack area in the front lobby so the kids could get goodies. All those things really make a difference when you're traveling. The staff was very nice...brought our luggage in immediately. There was ample parking. The breakfast was very nice and made-to-order omelettes. We heard no noise from the airport at all. This hotel is a hop, skip and jump from Awatukee and only 10-15 minutes from Sun Lakes where other family lives. Plus, easy access to downtown/historic area and museums. It's a treat when you can find an affordable find like this with such quality. We are sure to stay here again because each and every one of us really enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Uncomfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: penntf
Reviews.Content: After looking at some of the reviews, it appears as though this hotel may be somewhat inconsistent regarding room types and room experiences. Here was my experience. First and foremost, the staff was wonderful. They were very accommodating when I checked in and were also helpful when I checked out. I had to leave the hotel at 4:30am, as did a few other travelers. Oddly, the driver of the courtesy van did not show up to bring us to the airport. The front desk attendant quickly got on the phone and ordered us a few cabs...free of charge. We were thankful that he provided a solution for us. My room was very nice and was clean. My biggest complaint, and reason for my low review is because I was very disappointed by the bed and pillows. I am a very regular Hilton Garden Inn customer and these beds and pillows were not comfortable at all. At most HGI's, I'm very impressed with the comfort of their bedding. I didn't get much sleep at all as the mattress felt as though it had lost all of it's padding and support. The pillows were very firm and I felt like my head was propped up high. It appears as though the hotel reads the reviews that are posted (great job by the way. more should do that). My only recommendation is that they need to focus on upgrading the bedding next.

Reviews.Title: “Unlike everybody else we had a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKTustin
Reviews.Content: If you park your car in this hotel, BE CAREFUL! You will have to park near the front lobby to be safe. We had a terrible experience. A thief siphoned our gasoline COMPLETELY (a full tank) out of our car gas tank. He cut the filler hose to the tank so we could not refill it. The manager was nice to lend us a DUCT tape so my husband can tape the filler hose together so we can go home to California. My husband made it work but the experience dampened our stay there for 3 nights. On top of that , we had a terrible experience during our 1st night. We were assigned to a room near the elevator. All night long, we could hear the elevator going up and down and we slept poorly. The bed was good but the sound was bothering us. I don't know why anyone was assigned to that room at all. We should have asked for them to move us in the middle of the night but we didn't want to repack our stuff in the middle of the night. They moved us to a room in the corner (end of the hotel). The room was just ok but the bed was terrible. In the beginning of the night it was firm but by morning, my side sank down like it had a leak or something. We parked our car at this end and I think it was a mistake. I wanted to give 1 star but the service from front desk was great in helping us to recover our bad experience. Also, the room was clean and nice (despite the bed). It is not the hotel's fault that a thief stole our gasoline so I gave a 2 stars. But overall experience was so bad that I can't give more stars. The hotel should provide more security and install a security camera in the premises. The gasoline that was stolen costs us $60 but to fix the hose, it costs us $160. It was the worst driving vacation for us.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Not-the-talc
Reviews.Content: First impressions, it looked rather dowdy and shabby; the carpets have seen better days; the color scheme of all browns and low lighting contributed to this. Redeeming features were very helpful and friendly staff, excellent towels and toiletries, and a good restaurant (there was nowhere else to go in walking distance). The pool area for a hotel of its size was large, private and well supplied with chairs and towels. We prefer the housekeeping and maintenance to be "behind the scenes", but the doors to all these areas were left open to view. The 24 hours business center was well-equipped and we could send output to the printer from our room with a secure code to print out when we went down. Overall, OK as a place to stay near Sky Harbor Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps we were unlucky.”
Reviews.Author: Oatlander
Reviews.Content: Called hotel from airport to request shuttle. After waiting 20 minutes and no shuttle,,, called again. Told that the battery in the shuttle had failed and asked to order taxi, which hotel paid for. Hotel room spacious and comfortable. Went to arrange early morning call and shuttle to airport but desk clerk kept picking up phone calls when I was talking to him until I got angry. Had meal in restaurant. Steak was OK but served with about a half pound of boiled carrots! My wife's Cobb Salad was good apart from the canned olives! Conrad, I think you would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: ELK06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on business. The front desk is quite pleasant and there are fresh baked cookies available upon arrival. I had a handicap accessible room, so I can't comment on what the regular rooms are like, although I believe all rooms come with a kitchenette. My room was spacious and the bed was quite comfortable. The fitness center is small but sufficient. Breakfast buffet offers yogurt, cereal, pastries, fruit, juices, coffee and an omlette bar.

Reviews.Title: “Your Typical HGI”
Reviews.Author: kabecker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night due to easy access to the airport. The hotel is located about a 10 minute drive from PHX. The rooms at the property were actually quite spacious and were clean. The hallway on the 3rd floor going to my room was a bit banged up. The air conditioning was quite noisy coming on and off all night and noises from the hallways were audible but didnt necessarily disturb me. The TV's are still the 10-15 year old tube-sets so it would be nice to see flat screens here. The service at the hotel was very good. I needed to return my rental car at 9PM and they came very fast to pick me up and return me to the airport. In the morning, the shuttle to the airport ran right on time and the gentleman driving us was very friendly and prompt. The coffee at the hotel was disgusting. But the hotel served its purpose as providing a comfortable accomondation to sleep at the night before a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed to be fresh and prepared for my interview!”
Reviews.Author: LaTchatch
Reviews.Content: Great soft and plush bed - big room. Very quiet! I didn't get a rental car so I ate at their restaurant and the Blackened Salmon was very good! Took advantage of their shuttle service which helped me to get there from the hotel - that saves $$$. Check-in staff were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel room for the $ paid.”
Reviews.Author: WandaS_10
Reviews.Content: Room was awesome. Very comfortable and clean. Had a refrigerator and microwave in room which I was not expecting. Stayed here at end of week long vacation. It was one of the best rooms we stayed in and the lowest price we paid for a room. I would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and it was a very comfortable hotel. I liked the layout of the room with the little kitchenette and couch area. I didn't get to use either area, but it was nice having a little extra space. The bathroom was always clean and the towels were excellent. I travel at least twice a month and these were one of the best quality towels I've seen in a hotel of this class. My only issue with the room was the size of the closet. I couldn't fit my suitcase (carry on size) in there as the safe took up half the space. Free parking and internet were much appreciated and the business center came in useful when I printed my boarding pass. You can print from any computer on their network and then pick it up from the business center. Breakfast buffet was $10.98, but it was decent. I had a great spinach and mushroom egg white omelette and fresh fruit. The staff here was extremely friendly and I look forward to my next trip to Phoenix. Hopefully get to use the pool next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - nice hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mjc_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel twice in August. Both times we had the same experience, which was great. The rooms were nice, the breakfast is great. and the staff was helpful. On both stays, I needed to get to the airport to deal with my rental car. They were great about helping me with the shuttle. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: ExpertComptable
Reviews.Content: NIce welcome, easy parking, restaurant and facilities, everything just right. Room has everything you need and cheerful staff making for an excellent stay - highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Would go out of my way to stay at Hilton Garden Inns in the future”
Reviews.Author: Flat_Earther
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an exceptional value. We got a suite with a kitchenette for a very reasonable price. It was so nice to be able to relax on the couch instead of having to sit on beds while watching tv. The room was very clean and well decorated. The man at the front desk was super personable. They had fresh baked cookies available when we arrived. There is a nice snack shop/mini mart closet in the front lobby that is handy for little things you need but don't want to run out and get. We ate at the restaurant. The servers were nice and the food was good. We sat down to eat at 8pm and it really took a long time to get served, and a while to get our food after that. I ordered the scallops, and they were perfectly done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: LM77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night before flying out the next morning for home. We chose the hotel based on the positive reviews and the proximity to the airport with a free airport shuttle. We arrived early, before Noon, and they found a room ready for us so allowed us to check-in. We had to return our rental car to the airport and we inquired about the shuttle. Not only did they pick us up from the airport after we dropped off our rental car, but they also provided free transportation to and from Mill St., the center of activity (shops, restaurants, etc.) in Tempe. So we took the shuttle from the airport to Tempe, had lunch, shopped and called for the shuttle to pick us up and take us back to the hotel. We took the shuttle again to go to the Mill St. area for dinner and again to the airport the next morning. Everything was run efficienty, the drivers were courteous and although there was a 10 - 20 minute wait from Mill St. to the hotel and from the airport to the hotel, it still saved the $25 taxi fare. In addition, the hotel was great - rooms were suites with kitchens, there was a bar and restaurant on site, a Waffle House across the parking lot too. The wake up call was right on time. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous to us. We were able to print our boarding passes from the Business Center computer/printer. We had a good night's sleep and returned the next morning to the airport for our flight home. Next time we go to Phoenix we will stay at this hotel. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Felt Safe as Woman Traveling alone at Night”
Reviews.Author: coloradogirl89
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned as a woman traveling alone arriving at night via the airport shuttle but there was absolutely no need to worry. The shuttle driver arrived promtly and was very friendly. The room was very spacious and clean and room service was quick and tasty. I would definately recommend this hotel as a perfect overnight when traveling in and out of Phoenix airport.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff that took care of all my needs”
Reviews.Author: sfink007
Reviews.Content: The restaraunt staff did a wonderfull job as well as the front desk staff. I was very impressed by the entire team and would recommend staying here for anyone traveling for business or personal reasons.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel in my western large territory.”
Reviews.Author: lauraandtaylor
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this location monthly for 3 years. The staff is friendly, competent and there has been no turnover during this timeframe. Comfortable to me means: smiling face, greeting my name, good food, convenient location and parking, attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: luvsf
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here while stranded at PHX. Pleasantly surprised upon arrival and the front desk person (Victor) was so helpful! Our room was $75 + tax. The decor of the hotel is very tasteful and our room was great! Kitchen style sink and counter and nice desk and free WiFi; loveseat AND chair, coffee table, small chest with t.v. on it; excellent king bed mattress and great linens and plenty of comfy pillows! Separate vanity area with a stool on the way into the bathroom; granite counter tops and great lighting! Excellent shower spray and nice, thick towels! Neutrogena toiletries which is always a plus. LOTS of countertop space in the bathroom with granite tops there & in the vanity area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel property, excellent rooms and excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler10111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at the Phoenix Airport for a last minute trip to phoenix on business and was very pleasantly surprised. It is nearby the airport, they offer shuttle service to and from the airport. I stayed in a suite and the suite has the best beds ever!!! Comparable to the Westin Heavenly Beds. The beds in the suite had a tempurpedic mattress feel and it even has levers so that you can control the firmness/softness of the bed. The hotel itself has a good restaurant/bar and pool outside was very nice! The front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. They even remember your name and always refer to you as Mr. or Mrs., that was a great touch, almost felt like staying at a Ritz Calrton!! Overall it is a great property to stay at whether you are there for business or pleasure. I will definately want to go back and stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: 1100Aero
Reviews.Content: My only mistake was not staying longer at this hotel. We traveled and stayed at several motels and hotels and the Airport Garden Inn was the best.

Reviews.Title: “HGI Phoenix Airport is great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: AZDennis2
Reviews.Content: The staff are always friendly and the hotel is always clean, I have stayed at this hotel many times and it has always been great. I travel to Phoenix often and this is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location is not good if you like to spent time in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Mitsarspb
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is not good if you like to spent time in downtown. You have to spent 20 USD for taxi. But it is very close to the airport and nice place for workshops or other business. And they have free airport shuttel. Food in the restaurant was pretty good, but breakfast is poor comparing to other US hotels is stayed. Swimming pool and gum are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities. Comfortable bed. Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alford_DT
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled from California to Florida with my daughter who is being relocated in the Navy. Obviously, we stayed several nights on the road. The Hilton Garden Inn-Phoenix Airport was my favorite along the way. The price was reasonable. The facility was outstanding and the bed was inordinately comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY HILTON”
Reviews.Author: BOSTONTRAVELLER55
Reviews.Content: Pleasant surprise after a long week of travel. Located near Sky Harbor Airport and a short distance off !-10. Staff was cheerful and attentive. We enjoyed the small restaurant/lounge on our arrival and the omelet bar for breakfast. Room was pleasantly appointed, clean, comfortable and quiet! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - do not let the poor reviews discourage you”
Reviews.Author: willshawna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling though the Phoenix airport to Mexico, we stayed at the HGI when we arrived and when we left. When we arrived at the hotel it was via the freeway and I could not understand the reviews of the "poor / dicey neighborhood", it looked nice to us, it looked like a business park and another hotel was across the street. The next day we left the hotel and drove away from the freeway on the city streets and we said "ah ha" a few miles away, past the business park, there were a few "Men's Clubs" but it was not scary and I did not feel it effected the hotel neighborhood at all. The hotel is very close to the airport (10 minutes) but you can not hear it at all. The rooms were nice, we like having the kitchenette and sitting area. The rooms were clean, great beds and nice linens. Both rooms showed a little wear here and there, yes the A/C was a little loud, but we would stay there again in a minute. The business center was very nice I was able to print out our boarding passed for our flight out. The hotel airport shuttle service was every half hour, we had to leave at 4:30 AM and it was right on time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RabyFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hilton Phoenix Airport after a trip to Flagstaff. The hotel was very nice, clean and easy to find. We only stayed one night and did not have time to use all of the amenities. The location was very central and easy to get to the places we wanted to visit (Desert Botanical Gardens, Arizona State University). The one incident that we experienced was that we had asked to take the 4:00 am shuttle to the airport. We got to the front before 4:00 and there were already over 20 people waiting for the van. Some of the people waiting took taxis instead of waiting. Caused more than a few anxious feelings.

Reviews.Title: “A winner”
Reviews.Author: shellbee22
Reviews.Content: With its suite like rooms and beautiful pool, it doesn't seem like an airport hotel. Kind of makes you want to stay. Great staff, breakfast and rooms. We got a great rate and the hotel provided taxi service (at their expense) for those who have flights at ungodly hours of the night. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Business Hotel -- And Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: visitmae
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel to stay in when travelling to Phoenix for work. The business breakfast comes with a chef who makes you whatever you want. So much more awesome than the traditional continental breakfast stale muffins found elsewhere. Beds are great. Rooms are big. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix Airport-I felt like I was at a spa!”
Reviews.Author: sailjomassachusetts
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Hilton Garden Inn and would highly recommend it. The staff was professional, helpful and very friendly. The food was excellent. The room had a very comfortable bed, small kitchen area, was extremely clean. I couldn't have asked for more. The pool area was a plus. Quiet, relaxing and once again, very clean. Free internet was appreciated, as was the business center (great for printing up boarding passes). The fitness center had up to date equipment. The free airport shuttle was quick, our driver extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service!”
Reviews.Author: Agentamy
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Garden Inn, Phoenix Airport. We were a large group, 5 of us driving in, 4 others flying in at 3 different times. We all met for our first night of our vacation at this hotel. The front desk staff was exceptional. The HUGE breakfast was perfect, the cook-to-order chef very accomodating and friendly. The rooms were spacious and well designed. I can't say enough about what a great experience my family had at this hotel. The parking lot has a Waffle House too which is great for late arrival snacks. The wireless internet and ability to print to the business center was a huge bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in HGI”
Reviews.Author: Eureka24
Reviews.Content: We stay at HGI's whenever possible and have found them to be of excellent quality. We arrived in Phoenix two days earlier than expected, having to pick up our daughters at the airport we decided to stay at the airport HGI. The room was up to our expectations and we decided to go to the Happy Hour for appetizers. The food was very good. The service was very poor. We waited for a server to take our order. We asked what were the appetizers available for Happy Hour and she showed us the appetizers on the full menu rather than the bar menu which had a wider variety. We had ordered an entree to take to the room. When we finished an appetizer we waited for 20 minutes for her to return. We asked for a box and our bill. She did not come around for another 20 minutes. We asked the other servers to assist us and all they said was they would tell our server we need assistance. When she brought the bill she did not have our entree and had not turned in the ticket to the kitchen. We cancelled the entree and found we were charged full price for the half price appetizer we did have. It took another 15 minutes to get a correct bill. Tonight, we thought we would give it a second try as anyone can have an off day. Tonight we were served in a reasonable time and the server checked on us once. We had to ask for a box and for a bill. The bill again did not reflect the half off prices. Tonight it took more than 10 minutes to correct the error. If we were in a hurry we would have been very upset not just aggravated. The only difficulty we had with the room was the refrigerator made a humming noise, finally we had to move it to get it balanced. The noise stopped but the unit was off balance and "walking" its way out of its area. The rest of our stay was what we expect from HGI's. This is a fairly new hotel and hopefully they are working out the kinks. No WiFi a draw back of HGI's

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: Huge fan of this property. It is perfectly located for business travelers. The rooms are comfortable. The staff are attentive. The gym is decent. Highly recommended for road warriors. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Bueller555
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Shuttle to and from the airport leaving every half hour - Very nice front desk staff - Free parking - Free wifi and business center - Clean room and very comfortable bed - Waffle House a 1 minute walk away. 24 hours with good, inexpensive breakfasts. Cons: - Ventilation system was amazingly loud. Had to turn off the system to get some sleep. - Room overlooking the pool was also loud. Pumps at the pool run constantly. - Water pressure in the shower was awful. While it's a good business-oriented hotel, I don't know if it deserves such a high Trip Advisor rating. If it was the summer, the loud a/c system would cause me to avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Francois_travels_Mtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the night before our flight back home; the free shuttle they offer comes every 1/2 hour and you can take it as many times as you want - we dropped our car the day before and the came to get us at the airport even if we were already checked in. Our mini-suite was clean and the wifi worked like at home - rare. Both dinner and breakfast buffet were good and staff was friendly...Great deal (127.00$) !!

Reviews.Title: “Service Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: VTLongTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: From the hustle of the van driver to the helpfulness of the front desk staff, the service on this stay was outstanding. The room was a suite that was very nicely laid out. The only negative was the noisy venitlation system.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel - All Around”
Reviews.Author: dragon41
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix Airport is a truely exceptional hotel. The entire staff is dedicated to taking care of the traveler. The food at the restaurant is tasty and the portions nice sized. Rooms are clean, neat, well kept! Nice selection of TV stations. Good variety in the pantry store. Excellent Wi-Fi in both quality of signal as well as speed of internet traffic. Parking was a little thin, but ok. The hotel was close to the airport and within a few minutes of some great dining. Overall, an exceptional hotel that was a joy to visit even for the most traveled business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: aktundraqueen
Reviews.Content: I had booked a suite but it wasn't ready when we checked in (we were early) but the room we did get was very nice. I liked the size, the lay out and the bed was very comfortable. We missed the sun at the pool, however the hot tub was very nice. We ate dinner at the on sight resturaunt and it was good food and very enjoyable and relazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and well kept! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: kestech
Reviews.Content: It is a new hotel, but none the less it is very well kept and run. My room was very clean and nice. The bed was very comfortable and if I needed anything the staff was there to help. I will defintely recommend and do plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RothesayGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Phoenix from Atlantic Canada and arrived after a long travel dayl. We can't say enough about the service we received here, from the front desk manager, Bill, to the shuttle driver, Matt, the housekeeping staff, and the lounge/dining staff. We were travelling with friends, who arrived much later than us, and Bill ensured the shuttle arrived promptly for our friends at the airport, as they had a 20 hour travel day, and they were taken care of quckly when they arrived at the hotel. The fitness room had excellent equipment, and we really enjoyed the wonderful suites. My only regret is that we didn't stay longer. We headed to Sedona for the remainder of our trip. But we did drop by again a few days later to collect a coat that had been left behind, and were greeted warmly by staff again. Defintely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutMrsE
Reviews.Content: We were in AZ for a reunion in Tucson. After flying into Phoenix, we spent our first night in AZ at this hotel before picking up our rental car and continuing down to Tucson. The hotel was an excellent choice - although it is the Hilton Garden Inn at the Phoenix Airport, noise is NOT an issue. The rront desk personnel, the shuttle drivers and the breakfast crew (cook and servers) were terrific. I would encourage anyone to stay here ... it was clean, roomy and quiet,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MommaKitty9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Phoenix just one night in order to catch an early morning flight out after being farther north in Sedona for a week. Nothing to complain about here! All very nice and very friendly. Shuttles run every half hour to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Greta rooms feel like your at home”
Reviews.Author: sharkman26
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this hotel first night of my trip because it was close to my next day business. They gave me a upgraded suite at no extra cost and the room was fabolous. Its was like having your own apartment quite and roomy but not to open. I felt very comfortable. The next night I stayed at a different hotel and I could take the down grade. I called the hotel (HGI) and they took care of everything and got me into a nice room just down the hall from my old one. I did all my work in the room and felt like I was at home. Its very important to feel comfortable when traveling for work and this HGI was just what I wanted. Also the omelet's are great =)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jpacclarent
Reviews.Content: Large room, quiet. Able to relax and focus on business at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “One of my nicest stays in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: agostjo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden is close to the airport, has a shuttle to/from airport that makes the stay convenient. The front desk staff was "top notch", as were the shuttle drivers who were pleasant and friendly. The hotel is clean, beautiful pool and restaurant. There is a waffle house on the property. My only "complaint" is that the hotel property is isolated from any stores, so it is necessary to have a car, or the shuttle is more than happy to drive you within in a certain distance. All and all it was one of the nicest stays in the Phoenix area, and a property that I will frequent again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Greentree32
Reviews.Content: Excellent service staff. Great buffet breakfast. Clean room. Nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Brief Stay at the Hilton Gardne Inn”
Reviews.Author: nike1963
Reviews.Content: This is a very well maintained property. The room was very well furnished with wi/fi kitchen including sink microwave refrig. The front desk was very pleasant. This hotel is maybe five minutes from car rental return near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: COLadyRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was one of friendly, competent staff. I called upon arriving at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport to inquire about the shuttle schedule and the availability of my room for early check in. The staff member on the phone answered my inquiries in a friendly, efficient and professional manner. Even the shuttle van drivers are friendly and seem to be looking out for the well-being of their guests. Upon arrival to the hotel, I was greeted promptly by smiling desk clerks greeting me by title & name. My room was ready as requested, despite the fact that I arrived late-morning. My mini-suite was well-appointed and clean and it was located, as requested, away from elevators, stairwells and other high-traffic areas. The only downsides to my stay were: a) Painfully slow Wi-Fi b) Small (standard 12-passenger) shuttle vans that are difficult for some adults to get in to and out of and c) the seedy part of town the shuttle vans must traverse to get visitors from the airport to the hotel and back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikwitt
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean, nice hotel. My room on the third floor was renovated with a flat screen TV and a new bed. This hotel looked brand new. The outdoor area wasn't resort like, however the large pool was much nicer than your standard pool. The airport was also very close by. Overall, nicer than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms redone, loud on highway side....”
Reviews.Author: EduardTravels
Reviews.Content: This HGI is very close to the airport. My room was recently updated with nice work area, flat screen TV, kitchenette, new bedding.... very nice. Room service was great - I asked for something a little different than was on the menu (shrimp instead of chicken with my pasta) and it was no problem. Water pressure was a tad low in the morning. I had an even numbered room and heard quite a bit of traffic noise through the night. Even with that, wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: lkbphmd
Reviews.Content: Finding a relatively inexpensive yet nice place to stay near the airport for a quick stop in Phoenix is a little challenging. I ended up staying at the Hilton Garden Inn and was pleased with my choice. The shuttle service to and from the hotel is quick and easy. I called the hotel from the hotel courtesy phones at the hotel and within ten minutes the driver had picked me up. The trip back to the airport was just as quick, with scheduled service every half hour. I came down about 15 minutes early and the front desk person was willing to have him make a special trip, although I told her it wasn't necessary. Check in/out was rather simple as they had all of the information they needed before I arrived. The front desk clerk greeted me by name (we spoke earlier to arrange the shuttle) and continued to do so for the rest of his shift, which was a nice touch. The rooms are quite spacious, with a small kitchen area (mini fridge, microwave, sink), living room, and sleeping area. I noticed in another review that they had a flat screen television, however, my room did not. The room was clean and decorated in cheery yellow and blues. The sofa was a little worn, but I didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so it was not a big deal. There is a business center available 24/7 with free internet access, so you can print your boarding passes before heading to the airport. The pool area was nice with fresh towels placed on the lounge chairs. Several other chairs and tables, both in the sun and shade, were also available. As a HHilton rewards member, I had a letter and a small gift of thanks in the room, as well as vouchers for two free bottles of water. I left the gift but did quite appreciate the water, just make sure to drink it before going through security at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good service, not a particularly great bargain”
Reviews.Author: GaryKarr
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are quite nice and large and the location near the airport is obviously the main attraction. But I am not sure it's worth $160 a night, which is what I paid for a Sunday night in March. The whirlpool when I was there was out, though a sign said I could use the one next door at the Holiday Inn Express. They have an airport shuttle that runs every 30 minutes starting at 4 a.m. There is a full-service restaurant in the hotel, including a bar. The rooms have very nice erg chairs and desk, a microwave and a refrigerator. My room also had a flat screen television, but it did not appear to have high-def channels accessible. A definite step up from a Hampton Inn, my usual choice of hotel in this general service-and-price range.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: travelalotPA
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of Hilton Garden Inns so booked a night here before flying out the next morning. Even though I am a Hilton Honors Silver I seem to have been given the worst possible room in terms of location. The room itself was nicely designed and decorated. The staff was very friendly. However we were on the first floor within 25 feet of a Waffle House restaurant. All night long there were motorcyles revving their engines. Also we could hear extremely loud hip hop and rap music from the cars that were pulling into the Waffle House all night. We travel often and this was without question the most sleepless night we have ever spent in any hotel the world over! Also there was water leaking through the recessed light fixture over the tub at 3am when the person in the room above took a shower. This was in room 104. I think this room never should have been assigned as this is a definite hazard. Overall a nicely decorated and friendly hotel, but not a place to get a good night's sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Close To The Airport”
Reviews.Author: LA_Paul
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Phoenix on business I always try to stay near the airport and I-10...the Hilton Garden Inn is close to both. Great rooms, very spacious with a small kitchen (small refrigerator, sink and toaster), living room area and separate bathroom (there is a door). There are a couple hotels near this property, but this one always seems to have a good price for the room. There is a Waffle House in front of the hotel, which is, well, a Waffle House. If you go over the interstate heading south, there is a McDonald's on the right. If you are looking for a few more dining options, head over the interstate then left on Broadway and head to Tempe/ASU.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: csm385
Reviews.Content: Our room was great value--spacious, well-laid out, and comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable and the lighting was attractive. This HGI serves dinner as well as breakfast. The staff were friendly and check-in was a breeze. Close to the airport and rental car returns. The only downside was the noise outside our room from the pool area of the neighboring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn Dirty Dingy”
Reviews.Author: A55
Reviews.Content: I booked a king size room from a AAA review, staying at this property for one night prior to a fllight. Upon arrival we were given a room on the second floor, the hallway,carpeting and elevator was showing signs of age. Upon entering the room we noticed the air-conditioning was not working, the front desk was prompt in reassigning us to another room. This room was showing wear and tear. The carpeting was dirty as were the drapes and windows. Upon retiring for the night, when we turned down the sheets both the bottom and top sheet were DIRTY. The front desk sent up another sheet (which was rumpled and dingy). When we cheked out the front desk just shrugged and said "sorry 'bout that" When we asked to speak to the Manager I was told he was not available. Please beware if you book a room here, It is not up to Hilton standards. AAA should reevaluate it's rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, minus the theives”
Reviews.Author: lovelybird46
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, nice high speed internet in room, and good shuttle service that will take you to restaurants, ect. Unfortunately I had a watch stolen from my room (with the do not disturb sign on- I did not even get maid service). The management was not at all responsive to this (I guess they hear it all the time.) That is why I cannot rate this hotel higher. I don't like having stuff stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: IronChefNeva
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the price. My room had a sitting and kitchen area!! Great for a low-cost weekend stay. The pool, hot tub, and exercise room were clean and well kept. Staff were friendly. I plan to stay here again when I return to the area. The only negative is that the bed was not as comfortable as some of the (much) more expensive hotels I have stayed in, such as the sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Ok For A Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Airport in Phoenix was ok, but I stayed here just after staying at the Hilton Tapitio Cliffs and this room was more expensive and not nearly as nice. The room itself was very nice, but the bedding was not of the usual Hilton quality and my room smelled like it had once been a a smoking room. The air conditioning system was also very loud and I ended up turning it off so I could go to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 3422 East Elwood, University & I-10, Phoenix, AZ 85040
